CodePen - CSS Topic - Spacing

CSS TOPIC - SPACING

HTML Tutorial

letter-spacing

The letter-spacing CSS feature controls the horizontal text character spacing. When rendering the text, this value is applied to the basic character spacing. Characters spread farther apart when the letter spacing is positive, whereas they are brought closer together when the letter spacing is negative.

See the Pen Untitled by Caroline Talbot (@carolinetalbot) on CodePen.

word-spacing

The word-spacing CSS property controls how much white space there is between words and tags.

Note: Negative values are allowed.

See the Pen Untitled by Caroline Talbot (@carolinetalbot) on CodePen.

Here are some other helpful resources; Basic CSS Letter-Spacing , Basic CSS Word-Spacing
